title: Mobile live view UX validation (pre-implementation gate)
description: Validate that Browserbase live view is usable on Dave's phone before writing any code

steps.action: Create Browserbase free tier account and store API key as credential-browserbase-api-key and project ID as credential-browserbase-project-id in Keychain
steps.expected: Credentials stored and retrievable via security find-generic-password

steps.action: Write and run a minimal Node.js script that creates a Browserbase session, navigates to a form-heavy test page (e.g., httpbin.org/forms/post), and retrieves the debuggerFullscreenUrl
steps.expected: Session created, URL retrieved, script completes without errors

steps.action: Send the live view URL to Dave via Telegram with instructions: 'Test this on your phone â€” try tapping links, scrolling, typing in form fields, and interacting with buttons'
steps.expected: Dave receives the URL and can open it in mobile Safari or Chrome

steps.action: Dave tests mobile interaction: tap targets, scroll behavior, keyboard/typing, and overall responsiveness
steps.expected: Dave confirms mobile UX is acceptable for hand-off scenarios (tapping, scrolling, and typing all work)

steps.action: Record go/no-go decision. Close test session.
steps.expected: Decision documented. If GO: proceed to s-b02. If NO-GO: revisit approach.
